answers.answer: Hi,Do you also have pain during urination? either lower abdominal pain or pain in the urethra?It is possible that you could have developed a UTI, but that chance is slight given a negative urinalysis.How old are you?Onset of urinary symptoms of diabetes do not occur suddenly but over time.This may be associated witth weight loss and fatigue.Individuals with IBS can also develop similar symptoms for the bladder during periods of stress.A blood test for blood sugar levels can help rule out diabetes.Do keep hydration above 2000 ml per day and try to increase intake of vitamin C from natural sources, but not if it irritates your bowel.Do keep us posted on your doubts and progress.Regards

question: hello  i have been suffering with  wanting the loo all the time  to pass water  had it on and of for 2 weeks but  since monday  it has been all day all night thought had in fection so i put  a test into the  doctors  and it came back normal today it is not to bad  going every hour instead of   every few min  today i feel   tired no energy  i all so sufer with  ibs   we have diabeties1 in our family  i had aunty that had it  but   i dont get thirsty at all like the symptoms are  please  does anyone have any ideas    thank you
title: urge to pass water all the time
